page.title: 17The Holmes
page.content: The Holmes is 369 acres of grassland either side of the River Trent.It is mentioned in the Domesday Book as water meadows. It has been administered as Common Land since that time.The Overseer of the Holmes is responsible for their upkeep and their administration,jointly with the Holmes Committee.A Spring auction is held and parcels of land called 'gaits' are let to anyone wanting to graze cattle on the Holmes.Sheep are only allowed on the East of the river,on Smithey Marsh. There is no winter grazing allowed.There are approximately 448 gaits of land.The ecology is that of meadow land,plants are those normally found but may be heavily grazed. Skylarks are common,as are most birds of field and hedgerow. Water fowl are to be found on the river.The hedgerows are ancient ones;interesting habitats.
